document.docAuthor: Asenjo, Angélico, Irmler, Ulrich, Klimaszewski, Jan, Chandler, Donald S., Fierros-López, Hugo Eduardo & Vieira, Juliana S.
document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

subSubSection.paragraph: 2 species are known from and are restricted to South America.

bibRefCitation.author: Jeannel, R.
bibRefCitation.refString: Jeannel, R. (1962 b) Les Pselaphides de la Paleantarctide occidentale. In: Deboutteville, C. D. & Rapoport, E. (Eds.), Biologie de l'Amerique Australe. Vol. 1, Etudes sur la Faune du Sol. Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique, Paris, pp. 295 - 479.

subSubSection.paragraph: 5 species are known from and are restricted to South America.
Key: Jeannel 1962b: 355 (species of the genus); Jeannel 1963: 362 (species of the genus).

Type species:
Mexiplectus emersoni O. Park, 1943
2 species are known from and are restricted to Central America.

Characters/Description: O. Park 1944: 243 (characters in key); O. Park 1952b: 104 (characters in key); Grigarick & Schuster 1980: 28 (characters), 54 (characters in key); Chandler 2002: 56 (characters in key).

bibRefCitation.author: Casey, T. L.
bibRefCitation.refString: Casey, T. L. (1893) Coleopterological notices, V. Annals of the New York Academy of Sciences, 7, 281 - 601, pl. 1. [Note: nominal year of publication 1894]

subSubSection.paragraph: 1 species is included in this genus from Central America. Characters/Description: Raffray 1898b: 211 (characters in key), 246 (characters); Raffray 1908a: 41 (characters in key), 81 (characters); Grigarick & Schuster 1980: 27 (characters), 54 (characters in key); Chandler 2002: 57 (characters in key); Chandler & Caterino 2011: 428 (characters). Key: Chandler & Caterino 2011: 432 (males), 434 (females). Distribution. Central America: Mexico . Other regions: Nearctic.

Type species:
Panaramecia williamsi O. Park, 1942
Only one species is known from and is restricted to Central America.
Characters/Description: O. Park 1942: 67 , 71 (characters in key); O. Park 1952b: 88 (characters in key); Grigarick & Schuster 1980: 29 (characters), 54 (characters in key).

subSubSection.paragraph: 9 species are known from and are restricted to South America.

subSubSection.paragraph: 8 species are known from and are restricted to South America.

Type species:
Thesiectus probus O. Park, 1960
Only one species is known from and is restricted to West Indies.

subSubSection.paragraph: 2 species are included in this genus from South America.
Characters/Description: Raffray 1904b: 586 (characters in key); Raffray 1908a: 114 (characters in key), 115 (characters); Grigarick & Schuster 1980: 27 (characters), 54 (characters in key).

Type species:
Verabarolus subdendrus O. Park, 1942
Only one species is known from and is restricted to Central America.

Characters/Description: O. Park 1942: 70 (characters in key); O. Park 1952b: 114 (characters in key); Grigarick & Schuster 1980: 29 (characters), 54 (characters in key); Chandler 2002: 56 (characters in key).
